description: Interaction scenes and recruitment opportunities for neutral factions that adapt based on PC faction allegiance and progression.

initial_contact.name: A Chance Arrangement - Brynjolf's Approach
initial_contact.trigger: PC enters Riften for the first time or visits marketplace
initial_contact.scene_description: Brynjolf, a charming Nord thief, approaches you in Riften's bustling market. He's clearly evaluating you, looking for someone with potential.

opening_dialogue.brynjolf: Never done an honest day's work in your life for all that coin you're carrying, eh lad/lass? Come on over here, I want to talk to you about a business opportunity.

player_options.skill_check: Rapport or Deceive (Fair +2) to seem interested

player_options.note: Can still be recruited later, Brynjolf tries again if PC commits crime

player_options.consequence: Thieves Guild becomes hostile, locks out faction

recruitment_pitch.description: Brynjolf explains he needs someone to create a distraction while he plants evidence on a competitor. Simple job, good pay.
skill_checks: Pickpocket (Good +3) to steal ring if taking that approach
recruitment_pitch.success: Brynjolf is impressed, invites PC to Ragged Flagon to meet Mercer Frey
recruitment_pitch.failure: Caught by guards, Brynjolf disappears. Can try again later with penalty to reputation.

imperial_aligned.brynjolf_comment: Don't worry about your Imperial friends. The Guild doesn't take sides in politics. Coin is coin.
imperial_aligned.note: Thieves Guild accepts Imperials but may have fewer targets in Imperial-controlled areas

stormcloak_aligned.brynjolf_comment: A true Nord, eh? Good. Riften's Jarl understands the value of... practical business arrangements.
stormcloak_aligned.note: Slight reputation bonus (+5) with Guild due to Stormcloak-sympathetic leadership

neutral.brynjolf_comment: Smart. Don't get caught up in politics. Let the soldiers fight while we make coin.
neutral.note: Standard recruitment, no penalties or bonuses

progression_encounters.name: Loud and Clear - First Guild Job
progression_encounters.trigger: Accept Brynjolf's invitation to Ragged Flagon
progression_encounters.objective: Complete training job with Vex and Mercer Frey
progression_encounters.npc: Mercer Frey, Brynjolf, Vex, Delvin Mallory

progression_encounters.name: Goldenglow Estate Heist
progression_encounters.objective: Burn three beehives and clear safe in Goldenglow Estate

progression_encounters.name: Speaking with Silence - Karliah Encounter
progression_encounters.trigger: After several guild jobs, Mercer betrayal revealed
progression_encounters.description: Meet Karliah, discover Mercer's treachery, learn about Nightingales

initial_contact.name: First Lessons - Farengar Secret-Fire Connection
initial_contact.location: Dragonsreach, Whiterun OR College of Winterhold entrance
initial_contact.trigger: PC shows interest in magic or visits College
initial_contact.npc: Farengar Secret-Fire (in Whiterun) or Faralda (at College)
initial_contact.scene_description: The College of Winterhold accepts those who demonstrate magical aptitude. Multiple entry paths exist depending on PC's location and progression.

entry_path_1_whiterun.trigger: PC completes 'Bleak Falls Barrow' quest or shows interest in magic

opening_dialogue.farengar: Ah, an adventurer. Perfect. I have need of someone with your... particular skills. I'm researching ancient Nordic magic and need artifacts. The College of Winterhold would be interested in someone like you.

player_options.farengar_response: The premiere institution of magical learning in Skyrim. They're always looking for promising students. I can provide a recommendation if you assist my research.

player_options.reward: Letter of recommendation to College, +10 College reputation

player_options.farengar_response: I can teach you basics here, but for true mastery, you need the College. Here, take this spell tome as a start.

opening_dialogue.faralda: Hold. The College of Winterhold is not open to all. You must demonstrate magical aptitude before entry is permitted. Can you cast a spell?

entrance_test.requirement: Cast any spell OR pass Lore check (Good +3) to demonstrate magical knowledge
options: Lore check to discuss magical theory
Show magical item as proof of interest
entrance_test.success: Faralda admits PC to College, introduces to Mirabelle Ervine
entrance_test.failure: Asked to return when more experienced. Can try again later or get recommendation.

recruitment_quest.name: First Lessons
recruitment_quest.description: Meet Tolfdir, attend first lecture, complete training exercise at Saarthal
skill_checks: Will (Fair +2) to maintain concentration during exercises
recruitment_quest.reward: Official College membership, access to trainers and facilities

imperial_aligned.npc_reactions: College is neutral but appreciates Imperial respect for learning. +1 to Rapport with instructors.
imperial_aligned.note: No mechanical difference, College stays neutral

stormcloak_aligned.npc_reactions: Some College members (especially Nords like Arniel) sympathize with Stormcloaks, but College officially neutral.
stormcloak_aligned.note: Slight tension with non-Nord mages but no penalties

neutral.npc_reactions: College strongly approves of political neutrality. Fits their philosophy perfectly.
neutral.bonus: +5 reputation for staying neutral in civil war

progression_encounters.name: Under Saarthal
progression_encounters.objective: Excavate Saarthal with Tolfdir, discover Eye of Magnus

progression_encounters.name: Staff of Magnus Quest Chain
progression_encounters.description: Recover Staff of Magnus from Labyrinthian to control the Eye

progression_encounters.name: Arch-Mage Ascension
progression_encounters.description: Become Arch-Mage after defeating magical threat

initial_contact.name: A Blade in the Dark - Delphine's Test
initial_contact.location: Sleeping Giant Inn, Riverwood OR Kynesgrove
initial_contact.trigger: PC investigates dragon sightings or interacts with Delphine in Riverwood
initial_contact.scene_description: Delphine, innkeeper of the Sleeping Giant Inn, is secretly a Blade. She's been watching you, evaluating whether you can be trusted.

trust_building.stage_1: Delphine tests PC subtly through conversations and observations
trust_building.stage_2: If PC proves competent, Delphine reveals her identity as a Blade
trust_building.stage_3: Delphine asks PC to investigate dragon activity and prove loyalty

opening_dialogue.delphine: You're that adventurer everyone's talking about. I've been keeping an eye on things, and something's not right with these dragons appearing. If you're interested in truth rather than coin, we should talk... privately.

player_options.delphine_response: Good. Meet me in the back room after midnight. Come alone.

player_options.note: Delphine waits, tries again later if PC proves capable

recruitment_quest.name: A Blade in the Dark
recruitment_quest.description: Investigate dragon resurrection at Kynesgrove, witness Alduin's power (or dragon activity post-Alduin)
recruitment_quest.objective: Prove you're capable and trustworthy enough to learn Blades secrets
skill_checks: Stealth (Fair +2) to avoid detection during investigation
recruitment_quest.success: Delphine reveals she's a Blade, invites PC to Sky Haven Temple

imperial_aligned.delphine_reaction: Cautiously positive. Blades historically served Empire, but Imperials now submit to Thalmor.
imperial_aligned.trust_penalty: -5 initial reputation due to Imperial-Thalmor connection
imperial_aligned.dialogue: I served the Empire once. But the Empire that bows to the Thalmor is not the Empire I knew. Prove you're different.

stormcloak_aligned.delphine_reaction: Approves. Stormcloaks oppose Thalmor, aligning with Blades' primary enemy.
stormcloak_aligned.trust_bonus: +10 initial reputation due to anti-Thalmor stance
stormcloak_aligned.dialogue: You fight for Skyrim's independence from those who destroyed the Blades. I respect that. We have common enemies.

neutral.delphine_reaction: Evaluates based on actions against Thalmor rather than faction
neutral.note: Standard progression, reputation based purely on PC's proven capabilities

progression_encounters.name: Alduin's Wall
progression_encounters.objective: Reach Sky Haven Temple, decipher Alduin's Wall prophecy
progression_encounters.unlocks: Access to Sky Haven Temple, Blades archives

progression_encounters.name: Rebuilding the Blades
progression_encounters.trigger: After establishing base at Sky Haven Temple
progression_encounters.description: Recruit warriors to rebuild the Blades order
progression_encounters.objective: Find 3+ worthy followers to join Blades
progression_encounters.note: Some followers may refuse if it requires killing Paarthurnax

progression_encounters.name: Thalmor Strikes - Anti-Thalmor Operations
progression_encounters.description: Conduct covert operations against Thalmor in Skyrim
progression_encounters.objective: Disrupt Thalmor intelligence, rescue prisoners, recover Blade artifacts
progression_encounters.story_impact: Major factor in Thalmor conspiracy storyline

initial_contact.name: Innocence Lost - Astrid's Abduction
initial_contact.trigger: PC kills someone (any NPC) OR learns about Aventus Aretino in Windhelm OR performs Black Sacrament
initial_contact.scene_description: You wake in an abandoned shack, hands bound. A woman in dark leather armor stands before you, a blade in her hand and an unsettling smile on her face.

opening_dialogue.astrid: Sleep well? You've been busy. Killing. Murdering. Either someone wants you dead, or you're trying to get our attention. So which is it? Want to join the family, or should I kill you now?

recruitment_test.description: Three bound captives are before you. Astrid demands you kill one to prove yourself.

player_options.astrid_response: Perfect. You have potential. The Dark Brotherhood will contact you again. Sleep well.
Oh my. Overachieving. I like that. The family will be very interested in you.
Shame. You showed such promise. I suppose I'll have to kill you instead.
player_options.consequence: Must fight Astrid or escape, locks out Dark Brotherhood
Triggers 'Destroy the Dark Brotherhood' alternate questline
player_options.note: Can wipe out Brotherhood instead of joining

post_test.description: Return to sleep anywhere. Astrid contacts you again, invites to Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary.

imperial_aligned.brotherhood_reaction: Neutral. Brotherhood cares only about contracts and coin, not politics.
imperial_aligned.note: May receive contracts targeting Stormcloaks, aligning with Imperial goals

stormcloak_aligned.brotherhood_reaction: Neutral. Will take contracts from any side.
stormcloak_aligned.note: May receive contracts targeting Imperials, aligning with Stormcloak goals

neutral.brotherhood_reaction: Appreciates neutrality. Makes you unpredictable and valuable.

all_factions.warning: Dark Brotherhood membership is secret. If exposed, faces persecution from all legitimate factions. Social consequences if discovered.

progression_encounters.name: Sanctuary Welcome
progression_encounters.objective: Meet Dark Brotherhood family, receive first contract

progression_encounters.name: Contract Kills
progression_encounters.description: Complete assassination contracts for gold and reputation

progression_encounters.name: Cure for Madness - Cicero Crisis
progression_encounters.description: Cicero goes mad and attacks. Must track him down.

progression_encounters.name: Emperor Assassination
progression_encounters.description: Ultimate contract: assassinate the Emperor himself

companions.status: Honor-bound warrior guild (neutral in Civil War)

initial_contact.name: Trouble at the Farm - Giant Slaying Introduction
initial_contact.trigger: PC encounters a giant attacking the farm (early Act I)
initial_contact.scene_description: A giant roars in pain as two warriors engage it. Aela looses arrows while Farkas closes in with his blade. The farmers cower. You arrive as the battle hangs in the balance.

player_options.option: Help the Companions defeat the giant
player_options.skill_check: Fight or Shoot (Average +1) to significantly wound the giant

player_options.note: The giant is defeated by the Companions; PC is chastised for inaction but can still approach

companions_recruitment_offer.dialogue: Aela approaches, impressed. "Not bad. You handle yourself well. Ever thought about joining the Companions?"

companions_outcome_observe.description: The giant collapses under the Companions' assault. Farkas notices you watching.
companions_outcome_observe.outcome: Farkas grunts about needing more brave souls. Aela still offers the PC a chance to prove themselves at Jorrvaskr.

imperial_aligned.aela_comment: You fight with discipline. Good. The Companions respect strength, not politics.
imperial_aligned.note: Companions are neutral but appreciate martial skill regardless of allegiance

stormcloak_aligned.aela_comment: A true Nord warrior. The Companions have always stood for Skyrim's honor.
stormcloak_aligned.note: Slight cultural affinity, +5 reputation bonus for Nord traditions
stormcloak_aligned.farkas_comment: Good to see someone who fights for what they believe in.

neutral.aela_comment: Smart. The Companions don't take sides in politics. We fight for honor, not banners.
neutral.note: Perfect alignment with Companions' philosophy, +10 reputation bonus for staying neutral

progression_encounters.name: Proving Honor
progression_encounters.objective: Undertake a trial mission with Farkas (retrieve a fragment of Wuuthrad from a tomb)
progression_encounters.unlocks: Official Companions membership, access to Inner Circle quests

progression_encounters.name: The Silver Hand
progression_encounters.description: Companions hunt a group of werewolf hunters (the Silver Hand) after a tragedy in the guild.
progression_encounters.story_impact: Inner Circle's secret (the beast blood) is revealed; PC must choose to embrace or cure lycanthropy.

progression_encounters.name: Purity of Revenge / Glory of the Dead
progression_encounters.description: After a great loss, undertake the final missions to avenge Kodlak and cure the Circle's lycanthropy curse.
progression_encounters.reward: Kodlak's spirit laid to rest, player can cure their beast blood if desired. Companions faction fully allied.

faction_interaction_matrix.description: How neutral faction membership affects and is affected by other allegiances

thieves_guild.imperial: Slight friction in Imperial cities with stronger law enforcement, -1 to Stealth in Imperial holds
thieves_guild.stormcloak: Better conditions in Stormcloak holds with weaker central authority, +1 to Contacts
thieves_guild.neutral: Optimal for Guild operations, no penalties

college_of_winterhold.imperial: Imperials respect education, +1 to Rapport with Imperial scholars
college_of_winterhold.stormcloak: Some Nords distrust magic, -1 to Rapport with Nord traditionalists outside College
college_of_winterhold.neutral: Best fit, +5 reputation with College for staying out of politics

blades.imperial: Complicated due to Imperial-Thalmor alliance, -5 initial trust
blades.neutral: Judged by actions against Thalmor, not political stance

dark_brotherhood.imperial: May receive contracts supporting Imperial goals
dark_brotherhood.stormcloak: May receive contracts supporting Stormcloak goals
dark_brotherhood.neutral: Receive contracts from all sides, maximum flexibility

companions.imperial: Companions officially neutral but may show preference for defending Whiterun
companions.stormcloak: Companions officially neutral but respect Nord traditions and independence
companions.neutral: Perfect fit, Companions honor neutrality in political conflicts, +5 reputation

multiple_neutral_factions.thieves_guild_college: Compatible. Can be scholarly thief or magically talented infiltrator.
multiple_neutral_factions.thieves_guild_dark_brotherhood: Compatible but attention-drawing. Committing many crimes attracts notice.
multiple_neutral_factions.thieves_guild_companions: Compatible. Both guilds respect honor among their members, though methods differ.
multiple_neutral_factions.college_blades: Compatible. Blades respect magical knowledge for combating threats.
multiple_neutral_factions.college_companions: Compatible. Companions respect all forms of strength, including magical prowess.
multiple_neutral_factions.blades_dark_brotherhood: Conflicted. Blades serve justice, Brotherhood serves death. Possible but causes internal conflict.
multiple_neutral_factions.blades_companions: Highly compatible. Both are honorable warrior organizations with proud traditions.
multiple_neutral_factions.companions_dark_brotherhood: Conflicted. Companions value honor, Brotherhood uses subterfuge. Inner Circle secret complicates this.
multiple_neutral_factions.all_neutral: Possible but challenging to manage. Divided loyalties and time commitments.

encounter_timing: Introduce 1-2 neutral factions in Act 1 before civil war commitment
Save most secretive factions (Blades, Dark Brotherhood) for later acts
Let players discover factions naturally through exploration and NPC interaction
Don't force faction membership - make it appealing through story and benefits
adapting_to_choices: Track which civil war faction PC joins (if any)
Adjust neutral faction NPC dialogue to reference PC's allegiance
Apply appropriate bonuses/penalties based on faction interaction matrix
Let PC's reputation in one faction affect others (positively or negatively)
creating_drama: Use faction conflicts to create tension (Guild wants to rob College, Brotherhood contract targets faction member)
Present moral dilemmas (Blades want you to kill someone, but they're innocent)
Make faction choices matter in story (Brotherhood contract affects civil war outcome)
Let companions react to faction membership (Lydia disapproves of Dark Brotherhood, etc.)
balancing_multiple_factions: Don't let PC join every faction simultaneously - creates diffusion
Limit active faction quests to 2-3 at a time
Make faction quests compete for PC's time and loyalty
Higher rank in one faction may demand more time, limiting other activities

optional_rule_secret_membership.description: For Dark Brotherhood and Thieves Guild, membership can be secret
mechanics: PC can hide faction membership from companions and other factions
Requires Deceive checks if questioned or if evidence of crimes surface
If discovered, companions may leave or demand explanation
Some companions (Serana, J'zargo) may not care, others (Lydia, Hadvar) may be horrified

discovery_consequences.thieves_guild_discovered: Legitimate factions distrust PC, -10 reputation with law-aligned groups, guards more suspicious
discovery_consequences.dark_brotherhood_discovered: Major scandal, possible arrest warrants, companions may leave, -25 reputation with all lawful factions
